item.title: TripAdvisor has identified Tokyo, Singapore, and Dubai as some of the top choices in its Cities Survey
item.description: Singapore at night. The travel website TripAdvisor recently published its second annual Cities Survey, which collected data from over 54,000 user reviews. The survey evaluated cities worldwide based on traveler feedback. Tokyo received the highest ranking for providing the best overall travel experience. It also earned top scores for its helpful residents, taxi services, public transportation, and clean streets. Tokyo ranked among the top ten cities in 13 out of 16 survey categories.

item.title: TripAdvisor simplifies the process of capturing important moments during a trip
item.description: TripAdvisor, the biggest travel website globally as of July 2015 according to comScore Media Metrix, has introduced a “Travel Timeline” feature for its mobile app. This feature allows users to record and share their travel experiences. When turned on, it automatically generates a timeline of the places visited and photos taken at each location. This timeline can be viewed chronologically or as a route on a map. Adam Medros, TripAdvisor’s SVP of Global Product, highlights the feature’s value in documenting and sharing travel memories.

item.title: Six Accor hotels in Australia have been inducted into the TripAdvisor Hall of Fame
item.description: Many Accor hotels in Australia have received recognition from TripAdvisor for their exceptional service in the tourism and hospitality sector. Several of these hotels were even honored for their fifth consecutive year of outstanding performance, earning them a place in the TripAdvisor Hall of Fame. Six Accor hotels achieved this Hall of Fame distinction this year: The Sebel Melbourne Flinders Lane Quay West Suites Melbourne The Sebel Maroochydore Pullman Palm Cove Sea Temple Resort and Spa Pullman Cairns International The Sebel Mandurah Accor Hotels Australia’s Chief Operating Officer, Simon McGrath, remarked that the variety of Accor brands, locations, and hotels featured in the 2015 TripAdvisor Hall of Fame demonstrates the high quality of the group’s properties across the country.

item.title: Bhaya Cruises has been awarded the TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence for five consecutive years
item.description: Source: Bhaya Cruises website. The luxury cruise company Bhaya Cruises, which operates in Vietnam’s Halong Bay, has received TripAdvisor’s Certificate of Excellence award for 2015. This recognition was given to three of their brands: Bhaya Classic, The Au Co, and Legend Halong. This marks the fifth year in a row that Bhaya Cruises has been acknowledged for its exceptional service. The Certificate of Excellence is a prestigious award within the hospitality industry.

item.title: The top hotels in Asia can be found in the Maldives and the UAE in the Middle East
item.description: Based on TripAdvisor’s rankings, this year’s best Asian hotels are predominantly located in the Maldives. Of the top ten, four resorts are in the Maldives and two are in Bali. Including three more Maldivian resorts in the top 25 results in the Maldives representing 28% of the list, alongside an additional Balinese hotel. India also has a strong presence, boasting four hotels within the top 25. Source: TripAdvisor website. The Gili Lankanfushi Maldives.

item.title: TripAdvisor announces the winners of the 2015 Certificate of Excellence for hotels
item.description: Source: TripAdvisor website. Many hotels in the Asia Pacific and the Middle East have earned praise from their guests on TripAdvisor. For example, the Sheraton Bandung Hotel & Towers in Indonesia received a TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence award this year. Akhmad Fadholi, the hotel’s General Manager, shared that the award was a source of pride for the entire team. He expressed gratitude to past guests who left reviews on TripAdvisor, emphasizing that customer recognition is the best kind of approval.

item.title: Three of the top 25 hotels in the world, as listed by TripAdvisor, are located in Asia
item.description: TripAdvisor’s 2014 Traveler’s Choice awards highlights 25 diverse hotels worldwide. Notably, three hotels from Asia secured spots within the top 10. Hong Kong’s The Upper House claimed the second position, while India’s Oberoi Udaivilas and Oberoi Mumbai ranked fifth and ninth, respectively. The Upper House, nestled in Pacific Place, holds the top spot among hotels in Hong Kong. One reviewer praised it as their “best hotel experience,” emphasizing its flawlessness. A remarkable 97% of the reviews for this hotel are positive.
